name: evolume
text: A comment left by evolume was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by kylank, TheLoneliestMonkey, mania3, flandango)

name: mysterymeat1001
text: Damn straight he's right. And do you know what makes for good chicken, sonny boy? Grass, corn, and bugs. Not antibiotics or that arsenic additive shit, just grass, corn, and bugs.

name: bjorntd
text: Plus eleven spices and herbs, and fear.

name: killingthejay
text: No, fear makes the meat hell of gamey. Modified death chickens for everyone!

name: mysterymeat1001
text: Absolutely. Ideally, the chicken shouldn't know he's dead until his head looks up and sees his body coming all crispy and delicious out of the fryer.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
i have no idea how that would work...but it could be awesome.

it thinks it's all lying on a sandy beach but it turns out it's really breading!

OOOOOOHHHHHHH SSSSHHHIIIIITTTTT!

name: lateadopter
text:
Sorry to be able to tell you this, but they're doing exactly that to fish in Taiwan .

The link is to a text story, but the story has a link to video of people eating a fish's body while the head is still alive. Somewhere else I saw a video of the actual cooking procedure, but I couldn't find that.

This is part of why I'm vegetarian.

name: flaaron
text: We all know fish don't have feelings.

name: cathaoir
text: Chubbied for scientific truth.

name: carlyle
text: Or maybe they do, but just in a way that's hard to care about.

name: atmus
text: If a fish had the choice, it would eat you in exactly the same way.

name: belgand
text: Great comment/avatar synergy here. I'm totally getting the impression that Ray has just dramatically turned towards the camera to give this pronouncement of theoretical piscine aggression.

name: deusoma
text: Chubbied for "theoretical piscine aggression".

name: tekende
text: That's one of the most frightening things I've ever heard of.

name: tripleg
text: TC Boyle wrote a very similar short story except about monkeys. monkey's brains.

name: selbencoirlo
text: And monkey's brains, though popular in Cantonese cuisine, are not often to be found in Washington D.C!

name: dusty

I lamed you. I'm so sorry. I swear to god I didn't mean it. Someone chubby him for me.

damn laggy mouse :(

text:
jesus! I'm glad someone else spotted that.. coming soon:
"Mt fellow Americans, all I got out of public office is a cloth-coat wearing Republican Roast Beef and a stuffed otter called Phillipe".. the 'Phillipe Speech' they'll call it.. at least Ray's watergate will be fun.. breakin' into Democrat HQ cause they have hella crispy Stellas and such..

name: vermy
text: Higher office changes everyone. Imagine what it would do to Pat

name: letterswewrote
text: ray is NOT fucking around... he's been angrily reading that paper for the last two days.

name: eric
text:
Ray's so hardcore about his presidential bid, he's been reading the SAME paper for the last two days.

Takes hella chochachos...

name: wittyname
text: And his eyebrows remain furrowed.

name: shoutingboy
text:
I think we've got our campaign slogan! "Ray Smuckles '08: Chickeny Chicken Again".

So when do the t-shirts go on sale? The California primary is in less than two weeks!

name: flazisismuss
text: You'd have thought science could have faked the authentic taste of real chicken by now.  Ideally, we would have some sort of extract we could add to any protein to make it taste like real chicken.  Instead, the dismal science has led to cheap factory chicken that has no taste.  This is one of the many ways that living in the future has been disappointing.

name: norrin
text: The old fake chicken used for McNuggets was delicious. Now that they switched to all white meat, which was what people claimed to want, it doesn't taste as good.

name: epicurus
text: Fuck yeah man, old Mcnuggets were like crack cocaine or something when I was little kid. Even then I hated everything ELSE at McDonald's, but those nuggets man, I stabbed a kid once because he took mine, straight up pen-in-the-navel shit.

name: eric
text: Hell yeah, all playing Russian Roulette with the one nugget that's all gristle and cartilage.  Invariably it was the last nugget in the 20 piece, you knew it was the gristle bullet but couldn't help but eat it anyway...

name: nokococo
text: But only the L-shaped ones.  The circle ones were less impressive.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i thought they looked more like a boot.

name: nokococo
text: It all depends on your point of view, I suppose.

name: belgand
text: It is a solid fact that white meat tastes like crap. It is dry and thoroughly unpleasant. Dark meat only.

name: tekende
text: Hell yes, totally agree.

name: notcool
text: But that's why God gave us gravy!

name: evolume
text: The answer you seek is MSG

name: king_duncan
text: Please, science can't even fake the authentic taste of strawberry .

name: philosophe
text: artificial grape? can we talk about that for a second? Where did flavor come from??? Doesn't taste like grapes!!!

name: gormster
text: Your avatar, your comment... perfect .

name: tekende
text: Is so good. Is so funny. Read today!

name: porquechutzpah
text: and that is why futurama is what the future will really be like. kind of annoying, some advances, but mostly, shitty relationship bullshit, and a man still has to have a shitty job to afford a crappy apartment with an alcohol-dependent roommate.

name: tekende
text: You are right. I have been to the future and can tell you that you are correct.

name: tekende
text: (I have not really been to the future.)

name: pyromancer
text: For another impressive vision of the future try David Foster Wallace's 'Infinite Jest'.  It's ominously whimsical but creepily convincing.

name: evolume
text: The Matrix didn't know what to make chicken taste like which is why everything tastes like chicken, but not enough like chicken unfortunately.

put can he promise chickens with no ding-a-lings?

that is not american.

As a french guy, i thought Ray would have more sensitive platform regarding meats. Veal is a forgotten meat, and lots of people are feeling that indignation.

Though, i'm pretty sure the Cilantro-ape ceviche comment will resurface at one point.

name: bjorntd
text: Ray is a man of the people. Veal is not a meat of your beer drinking American. Chicken is a good, Honest meat. I do not care for your gallic presumptions, your implication that we are of low mind.

Actually i was implying that Ray was a french guy, like he stated in a couple of strips.

I'm actually a de-naturlized french-canadian, which makes these series of strips so poignant to me.

Palpable poignancy.

text: My Grand-dad rarely fed us chicken. We ate good, honest venison and perch fried up with butter at his house. Sorry, Ray. I'm looking for a different kind of America.

Ray can't become President.

Come on, dude. This is a different age.

text: LEARNINATED!

name: tekende

Ah, damn, that didn't even occur to me!

See what we can accomplish when we all work together ?

name: happycat
text: All through Ray's run for office he looks really pissed off. That's the face I wear every time this election is talked about.

name: jesler729
text: I don't think Ray has ever had angrier eyebrows.

name: caddon
text:
Wait for the attack ads.

Ray Smuckles may say that he wants a return to good old fashioned American values. Flavorful chicken, zero tolerence on newspaper subscriptions, and a dismissive attitude towards Canada.

But perhaps Mr. Smuckles is forgetting about another part of 'Real America': having the courage not to desert a dying man.

thismessagewaspaidforbythefriendsofbensingtonbutters

name: wittyname
text: But, will he pull out of Iraq?

name: mastronaut
text:
Are there chickens in Iraq? No? Then what the hell were we doing there in the first place?

Next Question.

name: killerlimpet
text: No, but there is a white phosphorus munition known as "shake and bake."

name: wulvaine
text:
The reason we have not yet pulled out of Iraq is that President Bush has deep faith in condoms.

Hey, I guess that's another use for Molly's long condoms: To ensure that your country will not impregnate another country with a democracy.

name: mindbnder
text: everybody

name: coldfrog
text: Well, that seemed to have worked out for you bnder.

name: aaron_haynes
text:
Let me rephrase that.

Who the hell posts only so that they can get chubbies? It's a fine system for acknowledging that a person and their ideas are awesome, but mattfish seemed to be assuming it's the only reason anyone would post anything, to get as many people to give them positive attention. It's a good system, but it's not a damn contest.

name: spinynorman
text: While I don't think that many people post only to get chubbies, it certainly does seem like some people post just to get lames.

name: boredom_man
text: First.

name: boredom_man
text: Damn. The eerie silence of crickets chirping on violins which ignore my comment. Ain't I hot enough, ain't I rough enough, ain't I lame enough?

name: boingjones
text:
Thats the only reason why I post...

with pizza.

name: rowboat
text: The people have spoken; you can do just anything in photoshop and expect chubbies. And it is just. As it reads, it could be a riff on food fetishism or Engrish. Genius!

name: mattfish
text: ugh, no it can't it's just an excuse to talk about dicks

name: peterjoel
text:
Chubbies are achewood commenting currency.

"Here's a chubby for your trouble, young lad"
"Thank you sir! Thank you for this great kindness!"

etc.

name: baryonyx
text: We are all street performers in the great public square known as Assetbar.

name: spinynorman
text: We are spring-loaded dogs eternally landing nickels and chubbies on our noses.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
i can no longer read this strip normally without reading it as Ray actually saying this.

damn you.

text: Wait, I don't get it.  Is Ray supposed to be, like, Asian or something?

text: I'm going to go on record as saying that this is correct. One in the eye for the beef lobby!

name: cousinted

name: zebra
text:
As angry as he is right now, Ray has a long way to go to catch the Colonel.

A suit so gleaming white it was crispy. A tie so thin you could shave with it. Rage enough to kill a man.

name: mysterymeat1001
text: You rang?

name: loneal
text: Your username raises this comment to an unprecedented level of perfection.

name: cbtbone
text: I have never felt more like an American than while staying at a Motel 6.  I can't remember if they actually left the light on for me, but, somehow, the promise was enough.

name: bjorntd
text: Marquis Lafayette.

name: epicurus
text: This was a good post except then you just leapt over your desk and grabbed my lapels and hissed "You fucking idiot." into my confused face.

name: loneal
text: Fun fact: The word "poing" actually comes from the Middle English verb for "to leap over one's desk, grab another's lapels, and hiss obscenities into a confused face."

name: bjorntd
text:
God damn it. I ran out of chubbies.

I wish I could mine other strips that I did not feel so strongly about for chubbies to use on this page.

name: loneal
text:
I often wish the same thing.

PS You and I are the same age and live in the same city. What if we secretly know each other in Real Life?

name: wittyname
text: I don't secretly know anyone in real life. Do you mean coincidentally?

name: loneal
text: No, I pretty much meant secretly.

name: bjorntd
text:
Oh god, how weird would that be?

Why don't we both wear shirts that say "HAY I'M THAT GUY/GAL FROM THE INTERNET" and see if we spot each other. Or, you know, walk through the city in a perpetual state of disappointment.

text: Doubly ironic that Motel 6 is ACTUALLY owned by a little company called ACCOR.

name: streever
text: Irony is a literary or rhetorical device, in which there is a gap or incongruity between what a speaker or a writer says, and what is generally understood (either at the time, or in the later context of history)

name: rowboat
text: Thank you.

name: loneal
text: A dude with a rubber ducky icon takes special pains to correct someone and call him an idiot, but is in fact incorrect and an idiot himself. Irony!

name: streever
text: Another dude on the internet copies & pastes the definition of irony. kind of just for fun, not correctin' no one nor takin' a stance, just sayin', you know? Just sayin'.

name: loneal
text: You were correctin', but whatever. No cookies for you.

name: cbtbone
text:
I'm pretty sure the Motel 6 I stayed in was in AMERICA. That's why everyone there was wearing blaze orange hunting pants and no shirts, sitting in the backs of their pick-up trucks, smoking cigarettes, and talking about things Larry the Cable Guy had said. Oh yeah, and they weren't speaking French, they were speaking AMERICAN.

Sony owns Columbia Pictures but you don't have to go to Japan to see a movie.

text: ray looks pissed off.

name: fallom
text: Just like the last one this strip is better when read backwards.

name: billylk
text:
Oh my.

You are correct, sir.

name: streever
text:
Are you guys sure? I mean, I am confused by the opening even:

"?yar ,detcele teg ot nalp uoy od woh ,os"

It really made more sense read the proper way, I thought!

name: cbtbone
text: or did it?

name: tekende
text: Dude, stop it! Are you trying to summon Cthulhu?!

name: jlynes
text: Ia! Ia! Ray Smuckles Fthagn!

name: ampkit5
text: Ahhh, chicken.  Ray really knows what the American people want.

name: morypcaina
text:
Ray Smuckles '08
Tomorrow's recipe is Chicken.

name: streever
text: Tomorrow's recipe is still chicken

name: imitationcrab
text: Tomorrow's recipe: a Spatchcock Chicken Supper

name: ruralelectric
text: By reading, I gather that only a very few really had a good honest roasted chicken with trimmings stuffed in the can of that chicken. This is sad. Try it, you will cast presidential vote in favor.

name: rumblefish
text:
Some of the worst political decisions have been made when people just won't leave you the hell alone to read your damn newspaper while wearing the house coat Dennis Quaid wore in As Good As It Gets.

Hopefully Ray will buck this trend.

name: barrylegg
text: Ray's turning into an asshole.

name: philosophe
text: Well, he is a politician now.

name: streever
text:
manflesh.

Where is he.

name: halfdirt
text: MAAAAAAN-FLESSSSH! ; (

name: lost_buoy
text:
Don't you get it? Manflesh IS the San Diego Chicken! He couldn't possibly comment now, without a massive conflict of interest.

..And if he's not, don't tell me.

name: earendil
text:
Horatio is in some way connected with the San Diego Chicken... but you don't want to know any more than that.


Believe me you reeeeally don't want to know.

name: lost_buoy
text: You got a laugh! Chubby for you to put on the helm of the Vingilot .

name: earendil
text: um, i'm not sure how much everyone in the heavenly realms would like that...

name: davidp
text: I don't like this "angry Ray".  He might be self-assured and whatnot but there's no need to be ruuude to his friends.

name: bjorntd
text:
The Journalist Touched A Nerve.

And come on. It's not like he's being a cock to a stranger.

name: caseyb3
text:
Guys, this arc is terrible. It is like the local Ford dealership making totally topical commercials at their normal volume and taste level where the People Choose. It is like an Arbys commercial where the kind of anodyne, bloodless 'political discussion' they have in newspaper comics turns out to be about the five-for-five Ar-B-Qs versus the Market Fresh Sandwiches.

I don't know what Onstad is aiming for here, but the general vibe is like Garrison Keillor trying to hit on a visibly aging riot grrl: uncomfortable; unfunny; and monstrously unsexy. Reruns would be better. For the love of God, can we please have a punchline or put this shit to bed.

P.S.: Living in a hyper-service-industry-capitalist swing state means I have to deal with the asinine pseudo-political ads a few months before you. Maybe the punchline is Chris gets this shit in your head and then the third separate commercial in which the Hamburglar accuses Ronald McDonald of being a Muslim is going to make you throw yourself through plate glass. And you'll have deserved it for rating this shit a five. It wouldn't even deserve a 3 if it weren't almost at a 4.

name: irondave
text: I had no idea Ronald McDonald was a Muslim!

name: streever
text: The punchline is actually, "Creative re-use of panels"

name: falseprophet
text: Ray Smuckles/Jim Perdue '08

name: lost_buoy
text:
Perhaps, but I miss Frank.

[IMGS OFF]

It took a tough man to make a tender chicken.

name: dumase
text:
What is this strip doing with anything below a 4?
3.7s are reserved for flowcharts, guest strips and lengthy text entries. I thought we all had an agreement on this.

name: tripleg
text: writing in november 2008, looking back on this comment, it's as if onstad knew

name: changuitotuerto
text: This strip has not ben transcribed and i am mad as figs about it. It also hasn't been listed among the other ones in need of transcription.

name: rasalghul
text: Does John Layman read Achewood?
